title.rendered: Join the Fire Fighter Learnership Program 2024

content.rendered:
Apply for the Gauteng Fire Fighter Learnership Program 2024: Ignite Your Career in Fire Safety and Emergency Response.

Are you passionate about fire safety and emergency response? The Gauteng government is offering a Fire Fighter Learnership program for the year 2024 to 2024. This program provides an excellent opportunity for individuals who are interested in pursuing a career as a firefighter.

If you are seeking firefighter apprenticeships or job opportunities in the Gauteng region, this learnership program is the perfect platform to kick-start your career. The program aims to equip learners with the necessary skills and knowledge to effectively respond to fire emergencies and contribute to the safety of communities.

To apply for the Gauteng Fire Fighter Learnership, interested individuals can complete the fire fighter application form available in Guateng, Cape Town, and Nkangala District Municipality. This program is open to candidates who meet the specified eligibility criteria and are committed to making a difference in their communities.

By participating in the Gauteng Fire Fighter Learnership, you will receive comprehensive training and practical experience in fire prevention, fire suppression techniques, rescue operations, and other essential aspects of firefighting. This will enable you to develop the necessary competencies and confidence to handle emergency situations effectively.

Guidelines for applying for the Gauteng Fire Fighter Learnership 2024 are provided to ensure a smooth application process. It is important to review and follow these guidelines carefully to maximize your chances of being selected for this prestigious learnership program.

Don’t miss this opportunity to pursue a rewarding career in fire safety and emergency response. Apply for the Gauteng Fire Fighter Learnership Program 2024 and take the first step towards a fulfilling and impactful profession.

Requirements For Fire Fighter Learnership

  • 12th grade qualification (Mathematics and Physical Science preferred).
  • You must be at least 18 years old.
  • Must not be afraid of confined spaces or heights.
  • Medical and physical fitness are required.
  • Ability to work in a team and deal with stressful situations is required.
  • There is no criminal record.
  • Complete the learning institution’s Firefighter 1, Hazmat Awareness, Hazmat Operations, and First Aid Level 3 courses successfully.

How To Apply For Fire Fighter Learnership Program

All qualified candidates must take and pass the following mandatory fitness test.

  • The reach test (1.9 m).
  • 2.4 km run (Males 11minutes and Females 13 minutes).
  • Push-ups (30 in 60 seconds).
  • Sit-ups (30 in 60 seconds).
  • Dead load transports (2 x 25 kg drums over a distance of 100 m).

NOTE:

  • You must pass a written exam as well as an interview.
  • Be required to submit their fingerprints or identity numbers in order for criminal records to be checked. Other criminal clearances will not be accepted.
  • Be required to submit to a City medical examination.
  • Be required to take a mandatory drug test at a City testing location.

Special requirements for the position:

  • Non-permanent contract position for the duration of training.
  • Only after successfully completing the prescribed training will candidates be appointed to a permanent Learner Fire Fighter position.

Links For Firefighter Learnership Program Applications

  • Nkangala District Municipality Learnership
  • Link Government of Gauteng Learnership Link
  • City Of Cape Town (COCT) Learnership Link

Documents Required for the Learnership.

  • Original National Senior Certificate (NSC: Schools) or
  • National Certificate (NSC: FET Colleges) or National Certificate (NSC: FET Colleges) or National Certificate (NSC: FET Colleges) (Vocational).
  • Certified copy of South African Identity Document (not older than 6 months).
  • 4th National Senior Certificate (NSC: Schools) or National Senior Certificate (NSC: FET Colleges) (Vocational) certified copy (not older than 6 months).
  • Running shoes and workout gear.
  • Participants are required to bring their own water and snacks for the day. Participants must be prepared for any weather.
